channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Ukraine’s Equation
item.description: The West has fractured, and Putin knows it.

item.title: Struggle Over Americans’ Personal Data Plays Out Across the Government
item.description: Employees from Elon Musk’s so-called Department of Government Efficiency are gaining access to vast amounts of information held by federal agencies, e...

item.title: Not even DOGE employees know who’s in charge after the White House denies Elon Musk is heading the team
item.description: Who’s really in charge of the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE)? Even the White House and DOGE employees don't seem to know.

item.title: Meet Germany’s Far-Right Leader, a Study in Contradictions
item.description: Alice Weidel of the nationalist, anti-immigrant Alternative for Germany lives in Switzerland and is married to a Sri Lankan-born woman. She had led he...

item.title: Trump Media Group Sues Brazilian Judge Weighing Arrest of Jair Bolsonaro
item.description: The lawsuit came hours after the justice received an indictment of Brazil’s former president, who is an ally of President Trump.

item.title: Surprise U.K. inflation surge deals another setback to Labour government
item.description: The Consumer Prices Index jumped to 3 percent in January, up from 2.5 percent in December.

item.title: Cisco’s top exec spent 25 years climbing the ladder at one firm—she tells Gen Z and middle managers ‘you just need to be patient’
item.description: Gen Z and millennial workers think job-hopping is the only way up the ladder these days. But Cisco’s U.K. CEO’s career proves that patience is key to ...

item.title: European Leaders Try to Recalibrate After Trump Sides With Russia on Ukraine
item.description: The American president’s latest remarks embracing Vladimir Putin’s narrative that Ukraine is to blame for the war have compounded the sense of alarm a...

item.title: South Korean Officials Convicted Over Forcibly Sending North Koreans Home
item.description: The case of two North Korean fishermen, who murdered 16 compatriots before they sought asylum, has become a political minefield in the South.

item.title: Zelensky Urges ‘More Truth’ After Trump Suggests Ukraine Started the War
item.description: The remarks by President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine were some of his most pointed yet about President Trump’s views on the war.

item.title: Meet Germany’s Far-Right Leader, a Study in Contradictions
item.description: Alice Weidel of the nationalist, anti-immigrant Alternative for Germany lives in Switzerland and is married to a Sri Lankan-born woman. She had led he...

item.title: Trump Media Group Sues Brazilian Judge Weighing Arrest of Jair Bolsonaro
item.description: The lawsuit came hours after the justice received an indictment of Brazil’s former president, who is an ally of President Trump.

item.title: ECB extends hybrid policy that allows staff to work anywhere in the EU for 90 days a year after rave reviews
item.description: Nearly nine in 10 workers reported an improved work-life balance, giving central bank an edge in recruitment ahead of the private sector.

item.title: Exclusive: Verkada’s $200 million Series E values the company at $4.5 billion
item.description: Verkada has raised a $200 million Series E, boosting the company's valuation by $1 billion.

item.title: Zelensky Urges ‘More Truth’ After Trump Suggests Ukraine Started the War
item.description: The remarks by President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine were some of his most pointed yet about President Trump’s views on the war.
